website_summaries.verdict: A mid-level voice recorder that comes with a combination of some convenient features and a few design flaws.
pros: An upgraded model that has a vivid screen, user-friendly menu, and long battery life
Transferring files via the direct USB port is easy
Falls on the middle of the price spectrum
cons: On/off function is touchy when accidentally bumped

customer_reviews.title: All of the other features are nice but if you can't hear the professor
customer_reviews.text: not sure if it's me or if it's the recorder, but the volume is not nearly as loud as my old olympus that I paid 35.00 for a couple of years at Costco. All of the other features are nice but if you can't hear the professor, the other features don't matter.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia Urquizu

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: I like this recorder a lot.. There are a few minus points. The built in speaker is puny and produces low output volume. The inclusion of the USB connector inside the body of the recorder is I think is a mistake. It needs a lot of room around the port on the computer to be able to connect and it causes the recorder to be physically larger than it would need to be otherwise. A short USB cable is a better solution. The quality of the recording is outstanding when playing back on a computer. Nothing is perfect, but this close enough.
customer_reviews.author: R Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as expected
customer_reviews.text: This product was brand new, packaged well, and worked exactly as described. Seller did a good job explaining the product and the price point was competitive. If/when in the market, I will buy from this seller again. I use this in the courtroom for conference-type conversations. It picks up voices 20-30 feet away and I am very pleased with it. Will definitely buy from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Tari

customer_reviews.title: I like the new ones because the battery life and storage ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought two; thought they were going to be a vast improvement over some I bought a few years ago at half the price. I like the new ones because the battery life and storage is very good, but the reception on the old ones is better and these turn off very easily if you accidentally bump them when setting them down. I have to be very careful when placing them wherever I want to use them or I come back a few minutes later only to realize they are off!! Very frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: Emily R.

customer_reviews.title: nice recorder for the field
customer_reviews.text: I bought two within a one-month period (helpful hint: do not immerse). Replaces the somewhat identical VN-702PC I've used for several years when recording field notes while birding (and on occasion satisfactorily recording bird songs). Improvements include a power switch that moves from off to on (no spring!), a battery compartment cover that seems designed to hold up better, and a built-in USB connector (replacing the cable connection of the old model). Only time will tell if it holds up as well in the long run, but early indications are favorable.
customer_reviews.author: G. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: fancy whip cream
customer_reviews.text: This lil guy is awesome! Records super clear !!!!! Doesnt recognize a 64 gig micro sd but does recognize a 32 gig micro sd. that 32 gig can record a little over 554 hours of sound. records in mp3 and highest bitrate is 128 but the sound is super crisp and super clear! Battery life is supposed to last 110 hours. Plenty for ghost hunting!!!! :) Internal hard drive is 4 gigs and i recorded an hour and 21 minutes and the file size was 74 megs so you may not need to buy a micro sd card. I plan on storing all my recordings for backup on the sd card so i bought one.
customer_reviews.author: ErdwinJC

customer_reviews.title: Best equipment I've had for investigation!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a 6 hr paranormal investigation tour to capture EVP (electronic voice phenomenal) and this was the most solid concrete evidence we had in order to hear voices rather than claiming we heard something. Sure enough we caught some spooky voices and it came in clear enough to make out what it says. If this picks up paranormal sounds just fine, you know you'll be able to hear people talk clear enough to understand what they're saying!
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Very reliable brand.
customer_reviews.text: I had an Olympus Recorder that I bought back in 2000. Unfortunately, it died last month after many years of use and abuse. I decided to buy an Olympus replacement expecting the same reliability as the original recorder. So far I have been very happy with the features and the recording quality. Only time will tell but I am very confident it will last many years.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel B.

customer_reviews.title: A Wonderful Gift
customer_reviews.text: Got it yesterday, and it was a gift for my girl friend, she came over right away and put it to good use. This one is a lot easier than the one I have, but I will stick to mine. The sound is so clear. Now we can use them at church and in the class room. Thank you so much. There is even a video on Youtube.com of how to use it. Again, thank you so much.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Morten

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Not many people are writing on here for paranormal related uses but that's actually what this was purchased for! I found it's super easy to use and definitely holds a ton of hours worth of audio recordings. My boyfriend actually left this on overnight in his apartment and it lasted perfectly so I'm assuming this would be great to use in a lecture setting. Another great feature is the usb that comes right out of the recorder. Really easy to upload to a laptop or computer.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: This one is the worst recorder I ever owned...BE WARNED, WASTE OF MONEY!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned two other Olympus digital recorders both were great. They cost around $79 at radio shack. This one is the worst recorder I ever owned... WS-852 Silver. The Worst Sound Ever!!! Tinny and so bad I struggle to hear what was recorded. Can hardly make out the words it's so bad!!! I don't know how they can call it a recorder because it doesn't record it's unintelligible!!! It is painful and very stressful to listen to. Unfortunately one has to give 1 Star to get this review accepted but if I could I would give it -20 stars!!! Jennifer A, a verified customer.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer A.

customer_reviews.title: Fantasic Recorder
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a few months, and I wasn't sure I could part with my old recorder. But I love this thing. Despite having a different control layout than my old Olympus, this one is just as easy to use. I LOVE the direct connect USB. I do a lot of phone interviews, and having a recorder that will connect to the computer for upload was essential. In fact, that feature alone makes this recorder superior to the old Olympus, which came with clunky, awful software that barely worked.
customer_reviews.author: Lori D Widmer

customer_reviews.title: WOULD BUY AGAIN!
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this recorder. Have used it for over 30 hours of recording so far and it works fine. The only complaint is not about the recorder itself, but with the increasingly common practice of companies such as Olympus that do not include a complete manual with the item. In this situation, I had to print off the 80 pages manual from the Olympus website. Only after going through the manual was I able to figure out how the maximize the use of this recorder. Would recommend the clip-on microphone and the hard shell carrying case accessories. They make it so much easier to use this recorder.
customer_reviews.author: Richard M. Sola

customer_reviews.title: Great except for 1 small detail
customer_reviews.text: Everything is perfect except for one thing. Set Memory to microSD, then "recorded" 4 hours of content. The problem is I forgot to format the SD card so NOTHING recorded! Any other electronic device I've ever used tells you when the recording media is not active. Once I formatted card, recording went great! (Had to also change from Simple mode to Normal mode to get formatting option - one more pain.)
customer_reviews.author: Jay Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Great recorder,happy I got it.
customer_reviews.text: I had an Olympus recorder for 15 years which was excellent. It finally died and I got this one WS-852 and have used it for 2 months now. It's excellent, great sound quality, easy to use and very easy to plug into my USB port to upload. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Stratton

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: My husband has a earlier model and loved it. I purchased this one refurbished and it was a great deal. Easy to use and easy to download the recordings. Great sound quality. I've used it for school, for recording old voice mail messages I wanted to keep and for recording sounds off the internet. no problems after 6 months. Love it! I purchased a case off of amazon.com to keep it protected.
customer_reviews.author: DJP

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sound Quality
customer_reviews.text: I like these digital recorders and use them a lot. They have amazingly good sound quality. They are very easy to use. I like that they are small. The batteries seem to last forever. The capacity of the recording is endless. The only fault I've found was on my old one - a different model, the rewind button got screwed up and that made it nearly impossible to use. Hopefully, the newer model has fixed that problem.
customer_reviews.author: Christine G. Pattillo

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We use these daily with our jobs, this is the 3rd one I have bought (one for each staff member) Mine is 5 years old I love it easy to use durable, batteries last forever, picks up sound clearly, downloads audios easily, great product
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade to my older Olympus Recorder.
customer_reviews.text: This was an upgrade to the old, WS-2108 that I still have and use. It's now the backup. I use these for Board meetings and being able to slide the USB up and plug it in is so much easier than undoing the usb from the recorder and then having to reset the device if you left it out too long. This WS-852 has a neat little flip up stand that gets the mic off the table so you don't pick up a lot of ambient noise from surrounding people. Screen is easy to read even from an angle and it has tons of memory on it.
customer_reviews.author: Wardian55Top Contributor: Archery

customer_reviews.title: shuts off at random
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for a few weeks, now shuts off at random, even with fresh batteries. Lost all but the first few minutes of an interview. Also shuts off randomly when playing back.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for lectures!
customer_reviews.text: amazing. I got this for recording lectures. I was recording on my iPhone before, and this is so much better. It took me a minute to figure out the buttons, but this is definitely the one to use for school. You can listen to your recordings up to 2x the speed, or down to 0.25 times the speed. Ask your prof to let you put your recorder on their desk for best results. It has a headphone jack as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after only six weeks.
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. I purchased this hoping it was as great as the WS 700M. Worked hard for nine years. Stopped working after only six weeks. Only used it four times. No drops, no abuse, not a scratch on it. Fresh batteries, multiple attempts, won't even turn/power on. Geezzzz, what a disappointment. Past the 30 days to return, of course.
customer_reviews.author: Flowermaster

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I work as a court reporter and have used many recording devices including other Olympuses. The recording quality is great, my only complaint being that when I take his model in particular off of hold it takes a few seconds before I can start recording. Not a big deal unless you sometimes have to rush and start recording quickly like I do.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Bought one before but lost it.
customer_reviews.text: So far I like it. Not the simplist recorder but it works for me. Easy to upload to computer with retractable USB plug. Nice and small. Nothing's perfect so I only gave it four stars because it could be simpler but I grew up with a reel to reel and cassette recorder with very simple buttons. I guess I only get 2 stars. **
customer_reviews.author: Ron P.

customer_reviews.title: my digital recorder has to give me great sound and clarity to grab quotes whether in a ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my Olympus 822, which served me well for, gosh, four years of constant use. May it rest in peace. As a reporter, my digital recorder has to give me great sound and clarity to grab quotes whether in a crowded room or with screaming kids around. This one is great at noise cancelling those background sounds. The only thing I've learned, as with all my recorders, is to avoid windy situations. Otherwise, this recorder is a workhorse. You won't go wrong with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Hogan

customer_reviews.title: Olympus DVRs are great
customer_reviews.text: This unit replaces one that mechanically began to show wear, sloppy central button, foldable stand, etc, after over four years of near constant use. The data is still safely tucked inside. The new one is an improvement on the older one's already surprisingly good mp3 audio quality. While my phone has available apps to do what this device does, its nice having a pocket size DVR that won't try to take a message in the middle of a take. I use these for live mp3 audio recordings. The usb interface is superb.
customer_reviews.author: James Johnson

customer_reviews.title: died after 6 months

customer_reviews.author: rrhtrth

customer_reviews.title: This recorder is perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: This recorder is perfect for my needs. I sing with my community chorus & record all our practices. I love the retractable USB connector that enables me to plug it into the USB port on my car radio. I also plug it into my laptop. The sound quality is great when plugged in, but, given the size, not as good when unplugged from these devices.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Miller

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Digital Recorder
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this Digital Recorder. Features are easy to use and the display and key buttons makes it so much easier to record and transcribe audio. Feels quite sturdy and well built and audio is clear. Playback features allow you to easily slow the audio down when listening back to it or transcribing and the built in USB is plus. I am yet to learn all the features but so far, I'm in love.
customer_reviews.author: Regine

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hand recorder
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy with this hand recorder. Its microphone is sooooo sensitive, you hear everything!! It has mic and headphone jacks. Also really easy to pop the usb plug out and transfer files to a computer. I personally bought it for paranormal research and it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Zombie Killer76

customer_reviews.title: Decent - a bit complicated
customer_reviews.text: The quality is pretty decent although I'll admit that I had to return it. It was very confusing to use and while the batteries lasted a long time, there was no sensitivity setting that I could find and it picked up every bit of rustling that was close by. If that's what you are looking for, it's awesome. If not, maybe there's a sensitivity option that can be adjusted? As I got it for my older father, it was a little overly confusing for him.
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: 4 1/2 stars (almost perfect)
customer_reviews.text: Really crisp audio and simple buttons that are easy to learn to use in the dark. This is good because the screen is a little hard to see in bad light. I have gone through a lot of these small recorders over the past 30 years and this is the best value I have ever found.
customer_reviews.author: ChemGordon

customer_reviews.title: I love this recorder
customer_reviews.text: I'm a journalist and use recorders frequently. This one is ideal -- it's compact, reliable and has some great features including the built in USB. I have recommended​ it to many friends. Don't even think twice. Buy this terrific recorder!
customer_reviews.author: npdsleuth

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as prior versions

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I love how it lessens the background noise and focuses on my teacher's voice.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole

customer_reviews.title: Not satisfied

customer_reviews.author: Michelle R

customer_reviews.title: WORKS BUT IS FLAWED!
customer_reviews.text: The recorder tapes well and is clear. The problem is that you can't label the recordings so that you can go back to that particular recording. The device catalogs the recordings by number/letter and if you have multiple recordings, you have to play each one just to find the one you are looking for. They came up short on this feature!
customer_reviews.author: Palace101

customer_reviews.title: A better choice than my last one
customer_reviews.text: I've used three Olympus units now, and this one is the best so far. It is more convenient to use, to upload sessions to the PC, and the system menues are neater and faster to use. The unit's controls have stayed the same, so there is no relearning to do if you switch from Olympus to Olympus. A truly well-built unit. It does everything I need. I wish they had a small external mic with it!
customer_reviews.author: Gary H. Labowitz

customer_reviews.title: Keep Up The Great Technology 👍
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use, sleek design looks great and quality is excellent. This company has always made me smile 😃
customer_reviews.author: Sparks

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: Have been using it for about four months and it's still working great. Good audio quality and the direct USB connection feature is really convenient. No need to carry extra cords around. :)
customer_reviews.author: Shirl

customer_reviews.title: Exports in MP3 only, sometimes can produce a flat or tinny sound.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great device. I would recommend getting a decent quality lav mic. It works in a pinch for casual needs. If you do professional videos, you may want to look into a recorder that exports in wav, this only does MP3. I make videos casually and for friends/family and it works great for me on a budget.

customer_reviews.title: Simple but good recorder
customer_reviews.text: Not the latest and greatest technology, but it works very well and is simple and intuitive. I've used it for several months, and the battery is still on three bars, so I expect it to last a really long time. I only use it for personal dictation to be transcribed with Dragon, so I have not tested it for other purposes, like recording others etc.

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!

customer_reviews.title: Great for blind user

customer_reviews.title: Great for recording ideas on the fly

customer_reviews.title: fast, easy, effective--just what you need!

customer_reviews.title: I have two other Olympus Digital Recorders which I use all the time and like very much
customer_reviews.text: I never could get the volume up to an adequate level. I have two other Olympus Digital Recorders which I use all the time and like very much. I liked the additional features this one had to offer, but the difficulty with the volume was a deal breaker. I returned it.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely recommend it.

customer_reviews.title: Love them, 3rd one for me

customer_reviews.title: Read the User Manual (Available OnLine)
